alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:45AM CDT until April 15 at 5:07PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. .Heavy rainfall received on Wednesday led to minor flooding along the Big Piney River and Roudidoux Creek. For the Roubidoux Creek...including Waynesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, flood waters affect the lower TA 250 Training Area, Highway J east of Fort Wood East Gage, the Pontoon Training Area and the Happy Hollow Picnic Area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 645 PM CDT.
